title: Xi, Putin and Modi Try to Signal Unity at China Summit
summary: Their display of friendship in China was aimed at projecting an alternative to U.S. global leadership, even as serious differences among them remain.

title: India Was the Economic Alternative to China. Trump Ended That.
summary: A lurch in policy has shaken the India-U.S. economic alliance against China, leaving India little choice but to consider reversing its own strategy.

title: Hundreds Dead After 6.0-Magnitude Earthquake Hits Afghanistan
summary: The quake, near the border with Pakistan, injured more than 2,500 people, the authorities said. The death toll was expected to rise.

title: What to Know About the Earthquake in Afghanistan
summary: Hundreds of people were killed and more than 2,500 were injured, according to the Taliban government, and the death toll was expected to rise.

title: Judge Halts U.S. Effort to Deport Guatemalan Children as Planes Sit on Tarmac
summary: The temporary block ended another last-minute flurry of legal action over the Trump administration’s immigration crackdown.

title: Robert Mueller Has Parkinson’s Disease, Family Says
summary: The former special counsel, who led the Russia investigation during President Trump’s first term, has had difficulty speaking in recent months. A congressional committee dropped a request for Mr. Mueller to testify this week.

title: A Jamaican Man Served Time in the U.S., Then Was Deported to an African Prison
summary: The case of Orville Etoria highlights a tension in President Trump’s deportation agenda, in which immigrants can be sent abroad and detained indefinitely.

title: He Burned a Flag and Won a Right. With Trump’s Order, He Worries That’s at Risk.
summary: The Supreme Court ruled in 1989 that burning an American flag is speech protected by the First Amendment. President Trump says it should be punished.

title: Rudy Giuliani Is Hurt in Car Crash in New Hampshire
summary: Mr. Giuliani, the former New York City mayor and lawyer for President Trump, suffered a fractured vertebra, his head of security said.

title: What to Know About Rudy Giuliani’s Car Accident
summary: Rudolph W. Giuliani, the former mayor of New York and lawyer for President Trump, suffered a fractured vertebra when a vehicle slammed into his car on Saturday.

title: How Bad Bunny’s Puerto Rico Residency is Boosting the Economy
summary: Bad Bunny’s three-month concert series in San Juan is spurring a short-term surge in Puerto Rico’s economy.

title: Israel’s New Negotiating Stance Is Likely to Prolong Gaza War, Experts Say
summary: A shift toward pressing for a permanent cease-fire deal, alongside plans for a new offensive in Gaza City, means the fighting is unlikely to end soon.

title: U.S. Suspends Visas for Palestinian Passport Holders, Officials Say
summary: The move will stop, at least temporarily, travel for medical treatment, attending university, visiting relatives or conducting business.

title: Houthis Vow Revenge After Israeli Attack Kills Senior Officials
summary: Israel’s assassination of top officials last week is likely to make the Iranian-backed militia even more hawkish, Yemen analysts say.

title: Ukraine War Leads to Global Shortage of TNT for Military and Mining Use
summary: Mining materials to make cement, gravel and a host of other common products require an explosive that is becoming more expensive and limited in supply.

title: Kyiv Links Moscow to Killing of Former Ukrainian Parliament Speaker
summary: Ukraine said it had arrested a suspect in the murder of the politician, who had voiced anti-Russian views. The authorities did not explain how the suspect was tied to Moscow.

title: Where You Can Stumble Upon a U.S. Open Match
summary: A small part of the New York City tennis tournament is staged, miles away from the main action, at the gleaming Cary Leeds Center for Tennis & Learning in the Bronx.

title: Dan Rather Is Still Chasing the News
summary: He’s 93, and 20 years removed from signing off as a CBS anchor. But he’s still tapping out stories. “As Popeye used to say, I am what I am.”

title: In the Remains of Canada’s Jasper Wildfire, Clues to Tame Future Blazes
summary: A giant fire last year consumed much of Canada’s Jasper National Park. Canadian scientists leading research into wildfires are using the blaze to learn lessons for the future.

title: California’s High Potency Cannabis is Fueling a ‘Cali Weed’ Trend in the UK
summary: High-strength, California-grown marijuana is so popular in the U.K. that large quantities are being illegally smuggled on passenger flights, officials say.

title: Applying to College in the Age of Racial Trauma
summary: The new, higher premium placed on college application essays that focus on racially traumatic experiences produces numerous undesirable consequences.

title: We Ran the C.D.C. Secretary Kennedy Is Endangering Every American’s Health
summary: Agency leaders sound the alarm.

title: A Look at Vintage Photography From Our Archives
summary: We study photographers’ contact sheets from the last century.

title: Anti-Immigrant Protests Attended by Neo-Nazis in Australia Worry Leaders
summary: The government condemned the demonstrations, which drew tens of thousands of people. Some of the events included speakers tied to neo-Nazi groups.

title: South Korea Doctors’ Strike Begins to Wind Down
summary: Thousands of residents and interns were protesting a government proposal that would have dramatically increased the number of medical students in the country.

title: Brazil Tightens Bolsonaro House Arrest Amid Escape Concerns
summary: Former President Jair Bolsonaro, who will stand trial on Tuesday, is being closely monitored by the Brazilian authorities, who fear he may try to flee.

title: Why the Graffiti Artist Fonki Finds Inspiration in Angkorian Sculpture
summary: The artist Fonki developed a graffiti style that blends ancient motifs with scenes of modern Cambodia.
